description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 3a, lines 3-4. Physical description: 12 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Catchwords; rubricated through leaf 63. Some staining and a few leaves detached. Origin: Likely late 18th/early 19th century. Incipit: الحمد لله المتعالي في عز جلاله عن مطارح الافهام فلا يحيط بكنهه العارفون
author: Ibn al-Shahīd al-Thānī, al-Ḥasan, 1551 or 1552-1602 or 1603
abstract: Treatise on Shiʻite fiqh, incomplete at end.
extent: 172 leaves : paper ; 208 x 148 (132 x 91) mm bound to 208 x 153 mm
title: Maʻālim al-dīn wa-malādhdh al-mujtahidīn.
provenance: On leaf 1a, owner's note and stamp dated Rabīʻ II 1315 H [September 1897].
creator: ابن الشهيد الثاني، الحسن، 1551 or 1552-1602 or 1603
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
